conclusion: To answer the question about how the shadows A, B, C, and D will change when the light source moves to the back left or right, we need to consider the following factors:

premise: Position of the Shadows: Left Movement
conclusion: When the light source moves to the back left, the shadows will shift to the right. This is because the light rays will come from the left, causing the shadows to be cast in the opposite direction.

premise: Position of the Shadows: Right Movement
conclusion: If the light source moves to the back right, the shadows will shift to the left for the same reason.
The size of the shadows will depend on the angle of the light rays relative to the objects. Generally, as the light source moves further to the sides (left or right), the shadows tend to elongate.
A more acute angle (light source closer to the objects from the side) will create longer shadows.
As the light source moves to the left, Shadow A will move to the right and elongate.
As the light source moves to the right, Shadow A will move to the left and elongate.
As the light source moves to the left, Shadow B will move to the right and elongate.
As the light source moves to the right, Shadow B will move to the left and elongate.
As the light source moves to the left, Shadow C will move to the right and elongate.
As the light source moves to the right, Shadow C will move to the left and elongate.
As the light source moves to the left, Shadow D will move to the right and elongate.
As the light source moves to the right, Shadow D will move to the left and elongate.
When the light source moves to the back left, the shadows A, B, C, and D will shift to the right and will generally become longer.
